review.des:
Bar Siena is always busy no matter what day of the week you go there.
The food is always on point, my favorites are the grilled octopus, buratta, carni for the table(the portion is ginormous, serves up to 3ppl!), Steak tartare(just added to the menu, YUMM), and of course you can't miss the Bomboloni(best one in town).
The service was fantastic, very attentive bartender(Khit), so friendly, and the bar was so busy! I like hanging out here and Khit made me feel that I should LOVE hanging out at Bar Siena more often!

Really enjoyed the food here! I came here with my husband and his parents to celebrate my husband's birthday and we had a great time. All the pastas are homemade and the pizzas are amazing. I would highly recommend the gnocchi. The only thing that I think they can improve on is allowing guests to make slight changes to the cocktails. I wanted to substitute vodka for tequila in their #10 drink and the waitress flat out said no without an explanation. She had a little bit of an attitude as if I was making an unusual request. Anyways, aside from that, I would highly recommend this place for dinner! They even gifted us a super delicious donut for my husband's birthday. Really nice!

Great dinner, fantastic service, fun atmosphere!

Loved the entire experience. The food was excellent - each dish we tried was recommended by the server who schooled us on the menu (the goods, the greats and the bests).

The shaved zucchini salad was flavorful with a variety of nice textures from the span of veggies and Israeli Couscous. The dressing was perfectly balanced with acidity and a hint of sweetness.

Grandma's Gnocchi recipe is all the things! So tender, so smooth and creamy with a buttery almost mild cheese taste. The hand pinched prosciutto sausage is a-maze. This combo creates the perfect savory bite. Um, mouth watering!

The Wild Mushroom & Garlic Pizza was mild in flavors yet delcious! The crust had a perfect char.

Service was outstanding. The cocktails are perfection too.

LOVE!

I am a fan of this place for a girl's night out in West Loop, and I keep coming back for the seasonal cocktails. No. 13 is my absolute favorite and I'm going to try to recreate it at home. You will likely need a dinner reservation for this place on a weekend night, but I have had luck with putting my name in and waiting for a table. I would not say this is the best date night spot because it is really loud and there aren't great intimate spots for 2- but for a group or just a quick drink, it is really solid.

Ok, the meatball appetizer is good; not having green peppers bad.
Apparently, I get Snickers cranky when I get hungry. When I am offered pizza, but am told "it's not that kind of pizza" when ordering mushrooms and green peppers, I'm done.

What kind of weird alternate universe flat bread world am I living in when a pizza cannot be ordered to suit me? The staff was helpful and courteous, but what happened to giving the customer what they want? I do not get it.

Help me out Yelpers. What is going on with cuisine? I wanted something simple in West Loop on a week night around 9pm. Little Goat - too complicated and pine nutty (hate pine nuts - on anything). Aforementioned pizza; where do I go for an uncomplicated late night bite. Thanks.

Went on a Sunday for a recovery brunch with a friend.  Walked in and, shockingly, found two empty seats at the upstairs bar.  Quickly got our drinks and put in our order.  The bartender could tell I was "struggling," so she made me some magical concoction that I promptly downed and I felt a thousand times better.  The food was amazing and the beer was cold, but the bartender really made this brunch a great experience.  If you ever see a short-haired blonde bartender, try to sit near her!

Had some other friends meet us there, so we ended up moving to a table so we could all sit together and they could order food.  The waiter there really wasn't near as great as the bartender (service was a little slow and we did feel a bit invisible at times), but the food was still legit and the drinks were still cold.

I'd never have their pizza till this day and I WANT MORE.  I had their basic pep pizza.  Nothing fancy.  But my taste buds were smitten with that tasty pizza.

~Vegetarian friendly~

Brunch with my cousins!

We sat at the small bar upstairs and were served by Emily, the bartender. Special shoutout to her because her friendliness definitely made our dining experience that much more enjoyable.

We ordered...mimosas, the Puff Cake, Mushroom & Garlic Pizza, a side waffle potatoes, and toast. We shared everything and it was plenty of food. Everything tasted great too!

Definitely will be visiting again!

Great brunch and an awesome patio!! I came with a friend on a Sunday morning and we split the mimosa kit, which was amazing. They give you peach and raspberry purée and OJ with a bottle of prosecco in a super cute metal kit with ice.

I got the burrata wedge, while my friend got the breakfast sandwich. We split the waffle hash brown. I wasn't the biggest fan of the dressing on the burrata wedge it looks like semen it is ridiculously thick and gross, but it was my personal preference vs something being wrong with it as long as you enjoy thick dressing. My friend's sandwich and the hash brown waffle were AMAZING. I would order that next time.

Our server was Jonathan, and he was perfect. He knew when we were talking and to leave us alone, and he knew when it was time to check on us. He made sure we didn't have any allergies when we ordered and explained all of the questions we had.

My only complaint is that it is too far away from my house in the north!

SALT just excessive use of salt, left me feeling bloated and thirsty. From the supposedly fresh tasting "hamachi crudo, beef tartar, clams, shrimp and artichoke, pizza, pasta, red snapper, and short rib lasagna" simply over powering saltiness. One would expect that at a place priced not so modest the chef would be knowledgeable in choosing to flavor the food with spices other than just salt. We told the waitress about it but she just ignored it. Will not be returning. Two stars given for the bad food but good music.

Brunch was great! First time here and didn't disappoint. Somehow our party of 6 got lucky enough to not have a reservation or wait. The bloody mary was awesome because of this candy bacon it comes with.  The avocado toast was filling and the eggs were poached perfectly. My friend got the Croque Madame which looked delicious with a little side salad.  I will definitely come back.

My friends and I stopped by Bar Sienna for the first time Thursday for lunch. We ended up just sitting by the bar, which actually ended up working out for the best. Bria was our bartender and gave us some really awesome recommendations for food and drinks. Then we ended up splitting the Bombolatto which was amazing. The line was pretty crazy so it was great to just enjoy it from indoors. I'd definitely come back again, she made our experience fun.

We've been here for brunch and dinner. I recommend both! The staff is friendly and helpful when going over the menu. For brunch we had the breakfast calzone which was delish. The cocktails are fine but nothing special for $14 a pop (that's West Loop y'all).

For dinner I've had the gnocchi which was earthy and good. The short rib lasagna is rich but so yummy! And the fig prosciutto pizza was well balanced.

The bombolinis are yummy. I'm not a dessert person but I really enjoyed these freshly fried donuts :)

Great place! I enjoyed the atmosphere and our waitress was very helpful during brunch. I ordered the avocado toast and it was delicious! The champagne deal is fair but definitely not a bottomless deal - essentially you pay for a bottle of champagne and it comes with assorted juices for mixing. Not going to hold the whole *no bottomless brunch* thing against this place though. I'm sure they're just not going for that vibe - understandable. Only reason I gave 4 instead of 5 is because of a lack of vegan/vegetarian options. I was told that there is milk in "everything" - so this is definitely a no go for anyone with a dairy allergy or anti-dairy. Definitely a tip to Bar Siena to be a little more open minded with the menu as the anti-dairy vegan/vegetarian movement is on the rise. Otherwise - good food, good service, good drinks.

I went here on my birthday because I wanted to try to their dessert bar, Bombo Bar, but not stand outside in the cold waiting for the dessert. They offered me a free bombolini filled with birthday cake frosting, sprinkles and a candle on top!

My friend and I got a proscuitto and fig pizza. It was good, but not the best pizza I have ever had. It definitely feeds two people. The pieces of prosciutto were big and when I bit into it, I would drag the whole piece of meat off. There was a lot of parmesan dusted on it, too. It was also thought it was a nice touch that when you finished the pizza, the paper served under the pizza said: "If you're reading this, it's too late". I love the Drake reference. So bonus points to Bar Siena for that.

For dessert, I got my birthday donut. It was cute and definitely reminded me of a birthday cake. We also got a peanut butter fudge bombolini and Stracciatella gelato. The peanut butter fudge had a very strong peanut butter taste. I ate it with the gelato on top. It's not my favorite gelato flavor, but I wanted to try something new.

Our whole waiter/waitress was a little confusing to me. The hostess sat us with the menus. Then another girl came up to take our order. Then another guy came by and would pour us water, ask if we wanted anything else and basically turned into our waiter. It was nice that someone, no matter what, was looking after us. Although, I wonder why there was a change.

The only thing keeping this place from a 5 is where we were sat. It was next to the kitchen and super drafty from the cold. Also, I felt it was weird that we were sat there when I had a reservation. Almost like even though I planned ahead to book a seat, I still got a seat for someone who was a walk-in and needed to be stuck somewhere. I wish I was brought upstairs at least. Two parties seated before me and they got to go upstairs.

Overall, I'd still go back since they have many other choices and I didn't get to sit upstairs. The place looked very nicely decorated and I'd like to sit in a place where I can see that.
